pages.text: Root vegetables are the second most common type of food that exists in the world as we know it. Unfortunately, they have proven themselves to be harder to acquire in the wilderness in comparison to meat, as the $(bold)villages$() seem to hold an unstoppable monopoly on these foodstuffs, since they have only ever been found in their communities with some rare exceptions.

pages.name: The Villager
pages.text: A farmer villager from the villages, which hold a monopoly on root vegetables.

The glorious potato! The potato has been a staple crop of humanity for a very long time, but it can rarely be found in the wilderness of this world. Once thought to only be in the hands of the $(bold)zombies$() and the $(bold)villages,$() it has been discovered that they can be dug up from the $(bold)grass blocks$() of the surface and the $(bold)dirt$() beneath it.

Unfortunately, some potatoes have been cruelly stripped of their glory, and have grown rotten, for they naturally absorb harmful substances from $(bold)the earth they were dug up from.$() Maybe they might have some useful application in the future?

For hundreds of years, carrots have been hoarded by the small, compact, and arguably rare $(bold)villages$() that seem to hold so many root crops on their own. Fortunately, there is a new solution to this problem: foraging! Just like potatoes, they can be dug up from the $(bold)grass blocks$() of the surface and the $(bold)dirt$() beneath it.

The beetroot is a mysterious plant. It grows from a large, spherical seed, which is surprisingly tough, and can survive for years on its own. Although the $(bold)villages$() continue to hold a monopoly on the vast majority of root crops, beetroot can still be dug up from $(bold)the ground$() like the other foodstuffs thus far.
